intro: Diodioides, commonly known as the common diodii, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, often aromatic leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plants typically have a slender, erect stem and are found in temperate regions. They are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for ornamental purposes.
